page.title: 04Churches in Bugbrooke Area
page.content: There are 3 churches in the area, 2 Anglican and 1 Baptist. {St James the Great at Upper Stowe} built in 1854 has a membership of 30 and an attendance of 16, including 4 children. Services are held alternate Sundays. It was built to save the old ladies climbing the hill to Church Stowe. {St Michael and all Angels,Bugbrooke} begun in 1220 has a membership of 130 and attendances at the 3 Sunday services ranging from 10 to 90, including 50 children. {Baptist Church, Bugbrooke} was revitalised in 1969 and is called{Jesus Fellowship Church} It has become the centre of a large and growing religious community. It has a membership of 600 with attendances of 800 including 250 children at services on Wed, Frid , Sat & Sunday.
